meanings.definition: Use deception or trickery to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: She was chicaning her way into getting the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The con artist was chicaning people out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was chicaning its way into the henhouse.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like chicaning shadows, leading him astray.
meanings.sent5: The magician's chicaning tricks left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: Engage in petty or unfair practices in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: He was chicaning by secretly changing the rules of the game.
meanings.sent2: The student was chicaning by copying answers during the test.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was chicaning by stealing nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The politician's chicaning ways were finally exposed to the public.
meanings.sent5: The fox was chicaning its competitors in the forest race.
